content.description: Start with hands matched on the large, smooth edge at head-height
content.location: The back face of the Wall boulder

content.description: Many consider this to be the best problem at Nine Corners. Start sitting with a left hand on a good edge and your right on a sloper. Throw up a right heel and move up to a sloping crimp rail, using sidepulls out left to finally bump up to good left hand crimp. Make a couple more crimpy moves and mount the slopey topout.
content.location: The back face of the Wall boulder

content.description: SDS left of the large shelf below Thorazine on edges. Make a couple tough crimp moves till you can get your feet on the left side of the big shelf under Thorazine. Move up and left to a nice block, hang on and move to the high right facing arete. Turn the arete to the right and walk off over Thorazine.

Stand start in the middle of the face on a left hand sidepull and right hand edge.  Move up and right along diminishing holds to the find the right arete.  Climb up and left along the arete for the topout.
content.protection: Several pads and a spotter preferred.  Landing is OK if you can PAD the boulder well.

content.description: Start higher on the arete, left hand on an edge around chest height and right hand on a small edge around the right side of the arete.
content.location: It is to to the far right of the overhanging wall.

content.description: Sit start at base of arete with right hand on large jug and left hand on low side pull.  Climb the arete to the top.
content.location: Far right on main Wall Boulder area.

content.description: Sit start as Thorazine.  Once matched on lip, traverse the lop all the way to the right and finish as Heart Attack Man.
Start beneath tall slab.  Climb straight up.
content.location: It is to the right of Heart Attack Man.

content.description: Start on sloping edges underneath overhanging section.  Traverse first two moves of Bearded Arnie and then move up slab of boulder.
content.location: On backside of Wall Boulder. To right of Down Climb Slab.

content.description: Start on a faint pinch on the face and a sloping edge under the lip. Climb the right leaning arete all the way to its end, through cool moves and holds which all face the wrong way. I topped out around the right face above the small boulder to the right, but you could also top out on the left face at the same grade. Bit contrived due to multiple early exit options.
content.protection: Pads. Nice landing but you might want a friend to move pads if you choose to top out over the rock on the right
content.location: Right of the downclimb of the Wall boulder. Likely the first route on the Wall boulder you'd see from the trail, just past the Gate boulder

content.description: Home to a variety of quality problems, most notably Thorazine.
